With this new loan, she is in third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has fully repaid back, have supported her business promptly. Now, she is seeking for 2,500,000 KHR in order to buy pigs for raising for extra income, and pig feed plus buffalo. She hopes to increase her income and expand her animal husbandry on a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy pig, pig feed, and buffalo.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is a 29-year-old youth client from from Iraq. He lives with his family of 5 members, of whom 3 provide the income of the family together.

Hussain owns a shop where he launders clothes and irons them. He established his business in 2010 and gained his experience through working at a similar shop for several years as an employee. Now Hussain has his own employee hired and has gained an excellent reputation thanks to his fast work and on-time delivery.

Hussain is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD, which he will use to buy a motor generator and a washing machine. Hussain is aiming to grow and expand his business so that he may provide himself and his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and a washing machine.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is the mother of one child age four years old. She has shifted from selling airtime voucher cards to clothes. She has requested this loan to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 57, is a farmer from Pursat Province’s Sampov Meas district, Cambodia. To deal with the daily cost of living she plants orange and custard apple as the main source of income. The 10 years involvement in the current business has returned her about 21,900 KHR per day. 

Sokha has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for past two cycles and has repaid back her past loan already. The past loan enabled her to sustain her business on time. 

Now she is seeking for 1,200,000 KHR in order to smooth her plantation. She hopes to multiply her income so she can expand her farmland, especially in growing a new kind of fruit, cashew nut, for extra income.

loans.use: to smooth her farmland on her plantation.

loans.name: Emilia Rubidia

texts.es: Doña Emilia de 57 años de edad es una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora y honrada, trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan dulce y pan francés, y sale a venderlo por las diferentes colonias donde ella reside con las ganancias que obtienen logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo, su hija y sus tres nietos, doña Emilia  solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más pan. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para ella puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Emilia is 57 and a very responsible, hard-working and honest woman. She works in her own bakery where she makes sweet bread and french bread, and goes out to sell it around different neighborhoods where she lives. 

With the earnings she gets, she manages to cover some of her household expenses. She lives in her own home with her husband, her daughter, and her three grandchildren. 

Emilia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of flour, lard, baking tins, and everything she needs to be able to produce more bread. This project for improving the bakery is very important to her, as this way she will improve quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy flour, lard, baking tins, etc.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr: Madame Mariam est une femme mariée qui  vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur de l’élevage et pratique l’aviculture depuis 5 ans. Elle est membre à l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et elle sollicite un crédit de 300.000 francs CFA pour commander des poussins et acheter  des aliments pour leur nourriture. Son intention est d’augmenter sa production pour satisfaire la demande croissante de sa clientèle. Par  conséquent elle pourra accroitre ses bénéfices et contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille et renforcer davantage son fond de roulement. Il souhaite disposer d’un locale beaucoup plus grand  pour augmenter sa productivité en poulets.
texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman who lives in Senegal.  She is actively involved in raising livestock and has been working as a poultry farmer for five years.  She is a client of one of the branches of the UIMCEC, and she is requesting a loan of 300,000 CFA francs to place an order of young chickens and buy chicken feed.

Mariam wants to increase her production in order to meet her customers' increasing demand.  As a result, this will allow her to increase her profits, improve her family's food conditions and further strengthen her working capital.

Mariam would like to have a much larger farm, so that she could increase her poultry production.

loans.use: to buy young chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija de 11 años, Ella posee una venta de ropa tiene de diferentes estilos y  para todas las personas damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; Guadalupe  es muy activa siempre se encuentra trabajando,  luchando por salir adelante. Para Guadalupe el propósito y coraje que le pone a su labor tiene una dirección ver crecer el negocio para lograr un mejor futuro, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa en variedad como faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, trajes etc. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Ella  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 33, and lives in her own house with her life partner and her 11-year-old daughter. She sells clothing in different styles and for everyone: women, men, and children. The clothing she sells is very good quality and she sells it at affordable prices. That is why she has acquired a lot of customers lately. 

Guadalupe is very busy and is always working and striving to succeed. For Guadalupe, the purpose and courage that she puts into her work has one aim: to see the business grow so that she can achieve a better future. 

That is why she decided to request a loan from Integral, which will allow her to buy a variety of clothing such as skirts, pants, blouses, T-shirts, outfits, etc. In this way she will always be able to satisfy the needs of her customers. She hopes that this way she will succeed in giving her family financial security and a full life.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing such as skirts, pants, blouses, T-shirts, outfits, etc.

loans.name: Kos Wende Group

texts.fr:
Mme S.MARIE  est la représentante du groupe KOS WENDE. Mme se porte bien et à accoucher son troisième enfant. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Elle vend des condiments, des céréales depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de toécin et dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.
Elle veut  s’acheter  03 sacs d’haricots, 05sacs de mil et des condiments.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son commerce. Elle ambitionne  étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. Marie is the representative of the Kos Wende group. She is doing well and has given birth to her third child [since the time of the previous loan]. She is married and has three children. The oldest is 20 and the youngest is two. Two of her children are in school. She has five dependents.
She has been selling condiments and cereals for seven years. She stocks up at the large market in Toécé and nearby villages. Her customers are both men and women. She would like to buy three bags of beans, five bags of millet and some condiments. She would like to reinvest the revenues in her business. Her goal is to expand her business and improve her family’s life conditions.

loans.use: to buy three bags of beans, five bags of millet and some condiments.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is married and has one child, aged 17 years. She has been operating a retail business for one year now in her area. She sells products such as sweet potatoes and soft drinks.

She knew of Milango through friends, and now she is seeking a loan of 53,250 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock for her shop. She wants to raise capital to be able to start a fast food joint in five years. Her challenge is raising capital, and that’s what she wants to overcome. 

Grace wants to raise her living standard.

loans.use: to buy retail stock for her shop.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
This is Florencio. He previously accessed a PHP 15,000 loan that he used to buy more fish. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and with their personal, household and business expenses. He would like to apply for another loan, of PHP 51,000, which he will be using to buy a variety of fish for his business. His profits from his business will definitely help him to cover their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial improvement with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. He hopes to put up a new business and dreams to give a good life and education to his children. He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish for his business.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр житель города Кургантюбе. Ему 51 год. Он женат и является отцом одной дочери и одного сына. Его дети уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Жена Бахтиёра не работает, она ведет домашнее хозяйство. Сейчас Бахтиёр хочет заняться услугой такси. У него имеется сбережение, а также опыт вождения. Однако чтобы закупить автомашину и начать деятельность, ему не хватает денежной суммы. Поэтому Бахтиёр обратился за кредитом. Бахтиёр планирует предоставлять услуги такси по маршрутной линии города Кургантюбе и в день совершать пять рейсов.
texts.en:
Bakhtiyor is a resident of the city of Qurgan-Tube.  He is 51 years old, married, and the father of two adult children, a daughter and a son, who now live independently.  Bakhtiyor's wife is not employed: she takes care of the household.

Bakhtiyor wants to provide taxi services.  He has some savings and is also an experienced driver.  However, he does not have enough money to buy a car and start working, and this is why he is requesting a loan.  He is planning to provide his taxi services along one of the routes of the city of Qurgan-Tube, doing five round-trips per day.

loans.use: to purchase a car in order to provide taxi services.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 42-year-old married woman  from Ubay, Bohol and the mother of six children. She runs and operates a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy materials for fishing like nylon, nets, hooks and others. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing like nylon, nets, hooks and others

loans.name: Abduqahhor

texts.ru: Абдукаххор женатый молодой человек. Ему 28 лет. Он живет с женой у родителей в городе Турсунзаде. Жена Абдукаххора домохозяйка, а его родители занимаются растениеводством. Абдукаххор имеет среднее образование. Он спокойный и трудолюбивый человек. Абдукаххор тоже занимается растениеводством. Он научился этому делу еще в детстве когда помогал родителям. Вот уже восемь лет как он занимается этим самостоятельно. Абдукаххор на небольшом участке земли построил парник, где высаживает овощи. Он запрашивает кредит для закупа минерального удобрения, чтобы обработать землю и получить хороший урожай. Абдукаххор за счет прибыли планирует приобрести себе машину.
texts.en:
Abduqahhor, aged 28, is a young married man who lives with his parents and his wife in the city of Tursun-zoda.  His wife is a homemaker and his parents are involved in agriculture.  Abduqahhor has a secondary education.  He is a quiet and hardworking man who is also involved in agriculture, a professional activity he learned while helping his parents when he was a child.

Abduqahhor has had his own agricultural business for eight years already.  He has built a greenhouse on a small piece of land, and he is growing vegetables.  He is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers in order to treat his soil and get a good harvest.

Abduqahhor plans to use his profits to purchase a car.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en: Amgalan is 37 years old and lives with her husband and four daughters in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Oyunbaatar works at a local state owned company. Her older two daughters go to local schools and her twin daughters aged two go to a local kindergarten. Amgalan has been working as a saleswoman since 2005. She has built a close relationship with her suppliers and customers over the years and now she is starting her own business of selling secondhand shoes retail at a rental counter of the local market. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of seasonal secondhand shoes to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, positive and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of seasonal secondhand shoes to sell to local customers

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is a 41-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 21 while the youngest is 7. She is engaged in seaweed farming. She grows seaweed. She has been growing seaweed for almost 10 years now. Josie requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy straw, additional seaweed seedlings and to pay the laborer's fee. In the future, Josie would like to expand her business to support her family and also to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy straw, additional seaweed seedlings and to pay the laborer's fee

loans.name: Tufaidi Group

texts.en:
The borrower, who is in his early 30s, is single. He has been selling milk for three years now. He works from 4:00 in the morning and sells up to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more milk and managed to sell to many customers. He also started selling sweet potatoes as bites. So when he boils milk he also fries sweet potatoes and he sells them as bites. He used the profit to take care of himself to cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more milk and sweet potatoes. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Tufaidi" with fourteen members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more milk and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru:
Ситора уже второй раз обращается за кредитом. Свой предыдущий заем она брала для увеличения товарооборота и на сумму кредита закупила шапки, банные халаты и домашние тапочки. За счет полученной прибыли она построила дом.
Теперь Ситора снова запрашивает кредит. Она хочет закупить ассортимент одежд на продажу и таким образом увеличить товарооборот. Ситора очень любит свой торговый бизнес, так как он помогает ей быть независимой и обеспечивать семью. В будущем Ситора планирует расширить бизнес и открыть магазин на рынке города.
texts.en:
Sitora is requesting a loan for the second time.  She had requested her previous loan to increase her commodity turnover and she used her loan amount to buy hats, bathrobes and indoor slippers.  With the profits that she made, she was able to build a house.

Sitora is now requesting a loan to buy an assortment of clothes for resale, in order to increase her sales volume.  She really likes her retail business because it allows her to be independent and to provide for her family.

In the future, she is planning to expand her business and to open a store at the city market.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Damas

texts.en: Damas is 41 years old. He sells glue and leather, which are materials used for making shoes. With the loan, he will buy more glue and leather which are used to repair shoes.The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more glue and leather which are used for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Seun's Group

texts.en: Seun is 29 years old and a citizen from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. She has two children who still rely on her as they are still young. For the sake of her entire family, two hectares of paddy rice cropping are the main source of income. Her husband also helps to earn extra income as a house builder. This business returns about 13,700 KHR per day. This is not the original loan for Seun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past two loans have kept up a good pace for her business progressively and she has fully repaid her past loan with success as well. With this new loan, she will spend her portion to buy four sacks of potash to support her farmland. She hopes that this purchase will boost her crop productivity on time and return a good income so that she can buy more pigs to raise for additional income.

loans.use: To buy four sacks of potash to support her farmland

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 32 years old. He is a father of one child. He sells clothes, and has been running the business for 13 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sweaters and trousers to sell. Profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more trousers and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap is a 41-year-old mother residing in a village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has one dependent child who is too young for schooling. To deal with daily basics for the family, she and her husband cultivate rice on three hectares as the main source of the family’s income. The current business that she has been involved with for 10 years returns about 15,000 KHR per day. Sopheap has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for the past four cycles and she has fully repaid the loans successfully. Now, she is applying for a new loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR and her group member, in the same group, is seeking 500,000 KHR. As the leader, Sopheap will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes to get back a high yield from her farming to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is a 41-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children aged 10 and 14, respectively. She is engaged in hog raising. She raises pigs to fatten and after a certain period, sell to customers. She has been raising pigs for almost three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and groceries for family consumption. In the future, Divina would like to expand her piggery business to support her family and to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and groceries for her family's consumption

loans.name: Pierre Celestin

texts.en: Pierre Celestin is 43 years old. He sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his three children who attend different schools.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is widowed and has a direct selling beauty products business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell to her costumers.

Gloria has been in this business for three years now and earns additional income from pig fattening, electronic load retailing, and buying and selling ready to wear clothing.

Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Faiz Group

texts.en: This group is called Faiz.and it consists of four women. They have applied for a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB in order to solve their immediate financial problems. Amria is the leader of this group. A native of Dhamar, Yemen, she is a 48-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are attending primary school. She has requested this loan in order to buy building materials such as sand, cement, and iron.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as sand, cement, and iron.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 48 years old. He sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, he wants to buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en: Yun, 46, is a widowed mother of six children living in a rural area of Pursat province. To sustain her family, she raises pigs and sells sweets in the village as her main source of income. This is the first microloan for Yun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pig feed. She hopes that this purchase will fatten her pigs in a healthy condition so that she can sell them for a high price and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia, ella se dedica  a la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su compañero de vida logran solventar los gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito para poder comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. y poder mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía, ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener una mejor vida con su compañero de vida.
texts.en: This borrower lives with her partner in her own home.  She makes a living in agriculture, sowing corn and sorghum.  With the profits she earns from her sales, and with help from her husband, this entrepreneur manages to cover household costs.  She is now applying for a loan in order to buy manure, seeds, fertiliser, herbicides and more.  She wants to improve her land - which can be seen in the photo - as this is her only source of work.  By doing this, she hopes to have a better life with her partner.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertiliser, herbicides and more.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: Don julio de 42 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra maíz y maicillo. Don julio  desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso  solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía que es donde siembra. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Julio is 42 years old and is very responsible when it comes to his household responsibilities.  He has always  sought to provide his family with the best life he can.  Julio currently lives alongside his wife and four children.  He is very hard-working and is always happy and enthusiastic.  Julio makes a living in agriculture, growing corn and sorghum.  He wants to increase his sales and so is applying for a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilisers, pesticides and more and to improve his land (which can be seen on the photo).  Julio wants this loan as he has no other income.  With it, he will be able to continue bringing home his daily bread.

loans.use: to  buy seeds, manure, fertiliser, pesticides and more.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es: Reinaldo de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo desde hace varios años también tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Reinaldo esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. y poder mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi obtener mejores cosechas para tener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Reinaldo is 39 years old and lives in his own house with his family.  He makes a living in agriculture, sowing corn and sorghum.  He has been doing this for some years now but also has a small shop in his house. Reinaldo is able to cover some household costs with his work.  Reinaldo is applying for a loan from "Apoyo Integral" in order to buy manure, seeds, fertiliser, herbicides and more, and to improve his land (which can be seen in the photo),  With this loan, he will have better harvests and thus a higher income.  He can then provide his family with anything that they need.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertiliser, herbicides and more.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña angela de 44 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos,  Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación desde hace 2 años. Doña angela solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda con granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, aceitas, salsas de tomate, etc. de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en: Angela is 44 years old and lives with her husband a two children.  She has s shop selling foods such as bread, soft drinks, oil, vegetables, fruit and sweets, as well as household items such as soap, shampoo and more.  Angela has been running the shop out of her home for two years.  Angela is applying for a loan to stock up the store with basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, oils, tomato sauces and more.  With more stock, she will be able to  serve her customers better and improve her sales.  This is her priority as it will help her home to prosper.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, oils, tomato sauces and more.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: Jose vive con sus padres y su hermana el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, jose solicita un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios  como fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y poder mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía que es donde siembra. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: José lives with his parents and sister and has been working in agriculture for a number of years.  His main crops are corn and beans.  José has a lot of customers as his products are very good quality, and available at accessible prices.  José is applying for a loan in order to buy necessary supplies, such as fertilisers, manure, seeds, herbicides, and to improve his land (which can be seen in the photograph).  José wants to be able count on this loan as he has no other income.  With the loan he will be able to continue taking home money to support the household.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure, seeds, herbicides and more, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Magodi, in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Christine is married, and has five children. She and her husband have been farming for five years, and are currently growing cashew nuts on their land. Christine is excited to start beekeeping because it is a good opportunity to earn income, especially since the dedicated service of the Hive Technicians means that she can focus on her farming. 

This is Christine's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to start a poultry project. In the future, Christine hopes to save enough money to build a new family home.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Frodouard

texts.en: Frodouard is 30 years old. He is married to a businesswoman. He sells electronics and has been in the business for the past four years. With the loan, he wants to buy more digital cameras for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land to build a house for his residence.

loans.use: To buy more digital cameras to sell

loans.name: Dimas Adalberto

texts.es: Dimas vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 14, 13, 11 y 2 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador. Dimas está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y poder mejorar su terreno que es el que muestra en la fotografia, ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Dimas owns a house where he lives with his wife and his four children aged 14, 13, 11 and 2. He has been working with agriculture for several years growing beans and corn, and by selling his crops he is able to cover the costs of the household. He is a responsible, honest, and hard-working man. 

Dimas is applying for a loan in order to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, manure, seeds, etc. This will help him to improve his piece of land (shown in the photo), since his earnings aren't enough to cover these expenses. The loan will increase his income and improve his economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, etc. and improve his piece of land.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en: Analou is a 38-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children who are eight and three, respectively. She runs a sari-sari variety store. She sells goods including eggs, noodles, soaps, sugar, coffee and canned goods. Analou requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy various products to fill her store with more goods like soft drinks, beverages and more. In the future, Analou would like to expand her business to support her family and to send to her children to school.

loans.use: to buy various products to fill her store like soft drinks, beverages and more

loans.name: Malonza

texts.en: Malonza is happy that his first loan helped to establish his business. He found an opportunity to supply tea leaves in his locality and now he is applying for another loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy tea leaves to supply. He wants to open a wholesale shop supplying this commodity.

loans.use: To purchase tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Santa Isabel

texts.es: Doña santa vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, su hermana y su sobrina, Ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y los elabora a precios realmente accesibles; ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo responsable y honesta, doña santa  esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, elásticos, zippers, botones, etc. y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Santa lives in her own house with her two daughters, sister and niece.  She has a sewing shop at home where she make all kinds of clothing.  Lately she has seen an increase in customers because of her excellent work and low prices.  She is a very responsible, honest woman who is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, thread, needles, elastic, zippers, buttons and other sewing notions so she can continue satisfying her customers and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, thread, needles, elastic, zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell.

Judith has been in this business for nine years. Judith earns more income from her general store.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 65 years old. He is married with 10 children between 10 and 36 years old. He has requested the loan to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Juan Arsecio

texts.es:
Juan Arsecio Y. T. tiene 47 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos.

Se dedica a la agricultura de maíz y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos: como fertilizantes, abonos, semillas para la siembra maíz, papa y comprar animales para engordar y después vender y alientacion. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. 

Su sueño es tener dinero para poder dar la educacion a los hijos.

Le gusta los animales y descansar en los tiempos libres.
texts.en:
Juan Arsecio, 47, is married and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar.  He belongs to the communal bank "Casasiche Chilipampa" which is half an hour from Guaranda.  The group works in agriculture and livestock farming, such as raising dairy cows and pigs.

Juan grows corn and potatoes and raises dairy cows.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells his produce at the wholesale market in the same city,  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers and seeds to plant corn and potatoes.  He also wants to buy animal feed and animals to fatten and sell later.  The loan will help him financially so he can cover his family's expenses.

His goal is to have enough money to give his children an education.  He enjoys his animals and likes to relax in his free time.

loans.use: To buy supplies to grow corn, wheat, beans and potatoes and animals to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Battsetseg is 27 years old and lives with her husband and son in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Erdenebat is 29 years old and helps his wife to run their family business. Her son Tengis is one years old and he just started going to kindergarten. Battsetseg and her husband have been selling children's clothing from a rental counter at the local market since 2010. They are well-experienced, communicative and friendly people. They want to buy a plot of land and build their own small house from their business profits. Currently, they live on their parents' plot of land in a Ger. Battsetseg is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of children's clothing to sell to local customers.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Sandra Yaneri

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer joven y muy dinámica con una edad de 22 años en una relación en unión libre y madre de 2 hijos la cual la mayor que es una niña está en el kínder y un menor. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual puto terminar con mucho esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio gracias al apoyo de sus padres los cuales le enseñaron desde pequeña a cultivar café, maíz, frijol, etc. Ella se dedica al cultivo de café en compañía de su pareja hace tres años cultivando sus propias tierras la cuales fueron obtenidas gracias a una herencia por parte de sus suegros el cual está ubicado a 300 metros de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada a pie diariamente. 

Ella solicita ayuda para fertilizar sus cultivos ya que esto ayuda a cuidar la raíz, la hoja y el grano en su totalidad manteniendo sana y vitaminada la plana.

Sus planes son agrandar más sus cosechas, tecinifarlas y asistirlas para obtener una excelente cosecha. Sus metas y sueños son poder ahorra para poder enviar a sus hijos a la universidad para que ellos se puedan preparar y hacerse cargo de los negocios de la familia ya que las tierras que ellos cultivan y trabajan hoy son la herencia de ellos.
texts.en:
Sandra, 22, is a young, dynamic woman who lives with her common-law husband and two children, a daughter in kindergarten and a little boy.  She received a complete primary education thanks to much effort and sacrifice and the support of her parents who taught her when she was young to cultivate coffee, corn, beans, etc.  

Sandra and her partner have been growing coffee for three years on their own land which they inherited from her parents-in-law.  The land is 300 meters from home so they walk there every day.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her crops to help care for the roots, leaves and bean, to insure a healthy crop.

Her plans are to expand her cropland, care for it and integrate more technology so she can obtain an excellent harvest.  Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to the university so they can get training and be able to take over the family business when they inherit the land.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Don Eduardo vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable,  don Eduardo necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas,  abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc.  don Eduardo  tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Eduardo lives with his wife and four children.  He is a farmer who grows, specifically, corn and beans.  His years of experience in the sector have been very valuable in allowing him to obtain the best harvests.  The land he cultivates is located in an agricultural area and he sells his produce to neighboring communities where he has many fixed customers.  People always prefer his produce because of its quality and really low prices, not to mention the unequaled service.

Eduardo needs to buy supplies but does not have the money to do so, and therefore he is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc.  He has a good credit record and is committed to paying back the loan on time.  He is also confident he will be able to give his family everything they deserve.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana es una socia emprendedora, casada, con 48 años de edad y con dos hijos desde hace 13 años tiene un tramo en el mercado de Granada lo que vende es calzado y artículos plásticos, lleva tres años de ser cliente de la institución y es muy buena cliente porque lleva 10 ciclos de préstamos consecutivos, uno de sus hijos le ayudan en  el negocio, anteriormente vendía granos básicos, cambia de rubro porque considera que lo que vende actualmente les genera más ganancias,  el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de artículos como 25 unidades de panas pequeñas, 5 docenas de vasos medianos, 12 unidades de baldes grandes, 24 unidades de panas grandes, 3 docenas de sandalias, 2 docenas de sandalias bajas, 2 docenas de sandalias de niñas etc.
texts.en:
Emiliana, 48, is married, has two children and has worked for 13 years in the market in Granada where she sells rubber shoes and plastic products.  She has been a borrowing member of the institution for three years and is a very good customer who has had ten consecutive loans.  One of her children helps with the business.  She used to sell basic grains but changed sectors because she feels what she is selling now generates more profit.

The loan she is requesting is to buy items including 25 small tubs, five dozen medium sized cups, 12 large buckets, 24 large tubs, three dozen rubber sandals, two dozen flat sandals, two dozen girls' sandals, etc.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco de 34 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a la elaboración de pasteles, francisco se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos como lo son, maíz y frijol cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos asi como muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla a los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Francisco desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Francisco is 34 years old and is very responsible when it comes to his household responsibilities. He has always sought to provide his family with the best life he can.  He currently lives with his wife who earns a living making cakes.  Francisco makes a living every year by growing basic grains such as beans and corn.  When the harvest is ready he stores his products in big bags - as shown in the photograph - so that he can later go out to sell them in the local markets.  Francisco wants to increase his sales and so is applying for a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertiliser, pesticides and more.  Francisco wants to be able to count on this loan as he has no other income. With the loan he will be able to continue taking home money to support the household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertiliser, pesticides and more.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Mercedes, tiene como 12 años de trabajar como pequeña comerciante, negocio que comenzó con el apoyo de su único hijo que tiene 28 años de edad, habita en el Reparto Schick una zona con pobladores de escasos recursos y hay mucha delincuencia, ella es madre soltera gracias a su padre quien le regalo un pequeño terreno pudo hacer con mucho esfuerzo su humilde hogar. Hoy en día intenta salir adelante con el negocio al que desea invertirle más productos como ropa, perfume y prendas, es por eso que solicita el crédito para con las ventas ayudar a su hijo a terminar la universidad para que sea un hombre de bien y pagara sus gastos básicos de la casa.
texts.en: Mercedes has been working as a businesswoman for some twelve years, having started her shop with the support of her only son, who is 28 years old.  Mercedes lives in Reparto Schick, an area where the people are very poor and there is a lot of crime.  Mercedes is a single mother but, thanks to her father who gave her a small plot of land, she was able to build her own, humble house, with a lot of effort.  Mercedes is now trying to move forward with the business and wants to invest in more products, such as clothes, perfumes and garments.  So, for this, she is applying for a loan so that, with the sales, she can help her son finish his university studies.  He will then become a good-standing man and she will be able able to pay household costs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes and garments.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica lives in Mwapala, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Veronica is married, and has four children. Both her and her husband have been farming for twenty five years, and are currently growing passion fruit on their land. Veronica likes working with Honey Care because they offer good services, and is looking forward to having another stream of income from her beehives. 

This is Veronica's first loan, and she plans to use the income to make improvements to her farmhouse. In the future, she hopes to save up enough money to build a small biogas catchment plant on her land.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Nur

texts.en:
Nur is a 47-year-old woman who is married to Lukman. They have four children. Salma, who is 25 years old, and Sandria, who is 22, both attend college. The other two children, Salim and Sarifa, are in elementary school. 
Since 2006, Nur has been running a business selling fried cakes and has been using the income generated from the business to assist her husband in covering the family's daily needs and school fees. To expand her business and increase income, Nur is planning on opening a kiosk in her house and also increasing production of cakes. To do this, Nur has asked for a loan of IDR 4,000,000. The loan will help her build out her kiosk and purchase cake-making equipment and ingredients.

loans.use: to build up her kiosk and purchase cake-making equipment and ingredients

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 61 years old and has two children. Pilar is single and her two children are in school.

Pilar is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Pilar has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Pilar would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a married woman and a mother of seven children, from CPG, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for several years now. This is the source of their income.
Geraldine is asking for a loan to buy materials for the repair of her wooden boat, like plywood, paint and nails. Through this, they will be able to improve their fishing business as well as their income. Geraldine hopes of making their fishing business a success and a sustainable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children, and also wants to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her wooden boat, like plywood, paint and nails

loans.name: Oscar Amildo

texts.es: Oscar de 37 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos básicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su esposa y sus tres  hijos, Oscar  esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en: Oscar is 37 years old. He has worked in agriculture for 20 years. This has given him the training and knowledge he needs to help his crops. His main crops are corn and beans. He sells his crops on basic grains agencies that are close to his residence. With the profits he makes from his sales he helps with his family's expenses. He lives with his wife and their three children. Oscar is asking for a loan to be able to buy agricultural materials that will help him plant his crops, such as: manure, seeds, fertilizer, etc. This way, he can earn more profits and keep helping pay the household expenses with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is aged 24. He is single and very impressive about his business. With the loan, he would like to buy more bed sheets and bed covers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets and bed covers for sale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Francis is married, and has one child. Both him and his wife have been farming for eight years, and are currently growing maize and mangoes on their land. Francis is excited to start beekeeping because he wants to eat some of the honey produced by his own hives. 

This is Francis' first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to pay for his child's school fees. In the future, Francis hopes to save up enough money to start up a transportation business.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Rosa Herlinda

texts.es:
Doña Rosa es una mujer de 34 años de edad, casada y madre de 5 hijos de los cuales los 3 menores estudian en la primaria en diferentes años de educación y los 2 mayores trabajan y no estudian. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo terminar gracias al apoyo de sus padres. Ella tiene experiencia en el cultivo de café ya que lo realiza hace más de 9 años en compañía de su esposo y el terreno que ellos cultivan es propio gracias a los ahorros de muchos años. El terreno está ubicado a una distancia de 6 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasportan en carro y otras veces a pie en compañía de sus 2 hijos mayores que son los que trabajan en la asistencia.  

Actual mente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de un vivero de café el cual cultivara posteriormente para agrandar más su cultivo y tener una mayor cantidad de producto sembrado. 

En un futuro ella espera poder tener suficiente capital para poder comprar un pedazo de tierra y poder cultivar 
más café ya que sus metas son trabajar para el estudio de sus hijos y poder heredarles un pedazo a cada uno para que puedan obtener ingresos y no trabajar un terreno alquilado.
texts.en:
is a 34 year old woman. She is married and the mother of 5 children. The 3 youngest are in different grades of primary school and the 2 oldest work and don't go to school. She was able to finish one year of primary school thanks to her parents' support. She has experience growing coffee since she has done it for more than 9 years with her husband. The land they grow on in their own thanks to many years' savings. The land is located 6 kilometers from her house and she goes by car and sometimes on foot with her two oldest children, who work as helpers. 

Right now she is asking for help to buy a greenhouse to grow coffee and then enlarge her crop later and have a larger quantity of product planted. 

In the future she hopes to have enough capital to be able to buy a plot of land and grow more coffee. Her goals are to educate her children and leave them a piece of land they can make income from and not have to work on rented land.

loans.use: to buy a greenhouse to plant and grow coffee.

loans.name: Nelci

texts.en:
Nelci is a 34-year-old lady and married to Arky. They have three children: Julivan, who is twelve, and Julian who is eight, as well as Satrio, 5. 
Nelci owns a business selling fried bananas and donuts, as well as various other sweets and snacks. She started the business with capital provided by her husband, and is now keen to expand and increase her income. To do this Nelci plans to increase the stock in her business, which she hopes will increase her income by enough to help her pay for her children's school fees and living expenses. Nelci is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Changamwe, Kenya. He is married with four children, two of whom go to school. For ten years Joseph has been selling charcoal and water for a living. He heard of Milango through friends and joined. Joseph is seeking a loan of 5,700 Kenya shillings to help him pay some water bills and hospital bills.
He also plans to raise school fees for his children through this loan. His major challenge is the water rationing that cuts on his income.

loans.use: to pay his water bill

loans.name: Edithe

texts.en: Edithe is 25 years old. She is single. Edithe sells different items such as sugar and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy more sugar and maize flour for sale. The profits from the business will also be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and maize flour for sale

loans.name: Halimjon

texts.ru: Халимджону 40 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Дети еще несовершеннолетние. Жена Халимджона домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Халимджон имеет среднее образование и более чем 20 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Он занимается шитьем и продажей чехлов и поликов для автомашины. Он имеет большой опыт по данному бизнесу. Халимджон справляется с бизнесом один. Он имеет большие планы будущим. Планирует обучать своих детей в хороших и престижных университетах, купить для них отдельные квартиры, и много-много другое. Он запрашивает займ для покупки материалов для шитья чехлов и поликов. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Halimjon is 40 yeras old. He is married and is raising five children. His children are all underage. Halimjon's wife is a homemaker and is raising children. Halimjon has secondary education and has been running his own business for over twenty years. He sews and sells seat covers and floor mats for cars. He has a big experience in this type of business. Halimjon has been in this business on his own. He has big goals for the future. He plans to have his children study in good and prestigious universities, buy separate apartments for them and a lot more. He is asking for a loan to buy fabrics for sewing of covers and mats. He is awaiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabric to increase working capital.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia lives in a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfall makes farming difficult and contributes to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food, the wild mangrove forests and the local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives. 

Cecilia is unmarried and uses her land to conserve natural forest cover. She is very excited to be able to start a honey enterprise and looks forward to putting the trees on her land to good use. 

This is Cecilia's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to help pay her college fees. In the future, she hopes to expand her production and start a honey business of her own.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 60 years old. He has sold fabrics and thread for thirty years. He is married with three children. With the loan, he would like to buy more fabrics to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase his savings.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to sell.

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en:
Virgina is a widowed woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Virgina is 40 years old and has one child who is in school.

Virgina has a bakery business in the Philippines. Virgina requested a PHP 10,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients, such as flour, sugar and eggs, for her business.

Virgina has been in this business for 2 years. Virgina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients, such as flour, sugar, and eggs, for her business

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is 39 years old. He is married, and they are blessed with three children. He has requested the loan to buy more leather and glue to use during this period for making shoes. The profits from the business will be used to renovate their house.

loans.use: To buy more leather and glue to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Yadira

texts.es: Blanca Yadira Mayor de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado al oeste del occidente del pais es propietaria de un negocio de mercaderia en general como : compra venta de ropa nueva para niños y adultos, cosmeticos, prendas de oro, calzado, entre otros productos de bisuterias, vende al contado y al credito a clientes fijos y eventuales, ofrece sus productos de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitacion, uno de sus sueños es poder realizar mejoras en su casa de habitacion y asi brindarles un techo digno a sus hijos, otros de sus sueños es poder ver realizados a sus hijos siendo unos profesionales algo que ella no pudo hacer, yaque desde muy temprana edad tuvo que salir a trabajar para apoyar en el sustento de su hogar, Blanca no es la primera vez que solcitad financiamiento y gracias al apoyo que se le ha brindado ha podido aumentar mas su negocio y asi ha logrado ofrecer diversas variedades de productos a sus clientes dejandolos sastifechos. El Objetivo de este credio es para incrementar a un mas su inventario ya que tiene varios pedidos de sus clientes que  tiene que entregar, por lo tanto esta solicitando nuevamente financimiento par ala compra de Ropa de niños y adultos cosmeticos, chineria entre otros. Blanca Agradece mucho lel apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos economicos.-
texts.en:
Blanca Yadira is married and has two children (minors). She is from a municipality in Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. She runs a general merchandise business, buying and selling adult and children's clothing, cosmetics, gold articles, footwear, and trinkets. She sells her products for cash or credit, to permanent and temporary clients, both at markets and at home. One of her dreams is for her children to become professionals, an opportunity she never had herself since she had to work from an early age in order to contribute to the income of the household. 

This is not the first time Blanca asks for a loan and thanks to previous support she has been able to increase her business, offer a wider range of products, and better serve the needs of her clients. The purpose of this loan is to increase her inventory, as she has several orders from her clients that she needs to deliver. Therefore she is again applying for a loan in order to buy more adult and children’s clothing, cosmetics, and other consumer goods. Blanca is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for offering their support to people with scarce economic resources.

loans.use: to buy general retail such as shoes, shorts, skirts, children's clothing, cosmetics and more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some food stocks and repair her cafe

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
Wilhelmina is a retired teacher who earns approximately PHP 10,000. She is 70 years old, single with no children.  She decided to live in her own house in Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

Wilhelmina has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. She is applying for a loan to purchase additional housing materials for repairs. Wilhelmina wishes to keep her record as a member in good standing with PMPC especially by repaying the loans in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase additional housing materials

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 39 years old. He is married and has eight children between the ages of 2 and 15. He would like a loan to buy more fabrics for use in his clothing sales business. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the school fees of his children.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Gerardine

texts.en: Gerardine is 40 years old. She is married with two children. Her husband is a driver. With the loan, Gerardine would like to buy more soft drinks and beer for sale. The profits from the business will be added to her savings.

loans.use: To buy more beer and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Belenda

texts.en: Belenda is a 33-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 7 children. The oldest child is 12 while the youngest is 4. She earns a living by raising hogs. She has been raising hogs for almost 12 years. Her husband works as a salesman. To be able to sustain her piggery business, Belenda requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy additional pigs, feed and pig supplements, for the pigs to grow fast and healthy. In the future, Belenda would like to expand her business to be able to save for her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feed and pig supplements

loans.name: Felita

texts.en:
Felita is a new member of PMPC who is applying for a loan to purchase additional fertilizers for her crops. She earns a living from her farming activities. She grows fruit and vegetable crops for sale and has been doing this for 5 years.  

Felita is 36 years old, married with 3 children and lives in Centro Hulpa, Tudela.

Felita dreams that she will be able to support the needs of the family, especially the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. 

Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Tabitha is married and has one child. Her husband works in business development training, while Tabitha farms their land. She has been working their land for twelve years, and is currently tending to a tree plantation. Tabitha is excited to start beekeeping because it will give her a source of quality honey that she can use for medicinal purposes. 

This is Tabitha's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to help pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

George is unmarried, and has been farming for six years. He is currently growing passion fruit on his land. Geroge is happy to start beekeeping because it is a good source of income, and Honey Care's Hive Technicians give good service on the beehives. 

This is George's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his beehives to help buy a motorcycle taxi that he can start operating. His hope for the future is "to educate my younger siblings."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Inday Flor

texts.en:
Inday Flor is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Ubay, Bohol. Inday Flor is a farmer and has been in the farming business for more than 12 years now. This is the source of their income.

Inday Flor is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm. Through this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. In the future, Inday Flor dreams of expanding her farm so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Al-Asdqa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Asdqa, which consists of three ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They took out a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Nour is a 31-year-old single woman who lives with her relative in Aden. She has been in the cloth trade business for many years. She is famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Most of her neighbors are her clients. She is making enough to lead a decent life but said her income is not sufficient to bear all of the daily expenditures of her family members alone. She is contributing highly to the family income to support her family through all of her hard work. However, due to low cash in hand, she is facing difficulties in fulfilling the demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a wide variety of cloth, incense and perfumes in larger quantities to add to her stocks.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth, incense and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Om-Fahd Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Fahd and consists of three ladies.
Anisa is a housewife who is 50 years old. She lives with her six children in Aden, Yemen. She makes a living selling clothing and perfumes, and decided to establish her business because she saw it as a profitable prospect. 
Anisa is requesting a loan of 80,000 Yemeni rials (YER) from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, etc. She states that this loan will help because it will allow her to buy varied merchandise to invest in her clothing business. This will increase her sales, generating greater earnings at the same time. She has future plans of making improvements to her house in order to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, etc. for her business

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines.

Nemia requested a 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for making ice cream to sell.

Nemia has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making ice cream to sell

loans.name: Alma Yanori

texts.es:
Alma es una joven de 25 años de edad en un estado civil en unión libre y madre de 1 hijo el cual vive y depende de ellos. Ella cuenta con un grado de educación primario completo que pudo cursar gracias al apoyo de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a cultivar maíz, frijoles y café. Actualmente ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz en compañía de su pareja la cual es su único apoyo en un terreno que es propio gracias a los ahorros y a DIOS el cual está ubicado en la misma propiedad donde ellos habitan por lo que el mantenimiento a sus cultivos es más fácil incluso su asistencia técnica. Los clientes para su producto ya desganado y limpio son las diferentes bodegas y pulperías en otros municipios fuera de donde ella habita.

Actualmente ella necesita ayuda para la compra de semilla certificada de maíz para poder cultivar ya que por medio de esta ella podrá cultivar más y sus ingresos serán mayores para re-invertir en su tierra. 

Sus planes son mejorar y abonar la tierra que ellos cultivan para que la semilla nueva se pueda pegar y la planta crezca sana y fértil facilitando el mantenimiento de sus cultivos. Su sueño son como toda madre apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios y lograr enviarlo a la universidad para que él pueda graduarse de una carrera de provecho y que no pase por la misma situación que ellos en su juventud.
texts.en:
Alma is a young woman.  She is twenty-five years old, is in a common-law marriage, and is the mother of one son, who lives and depends on her and her partner.  She has completed primary school thanks to the support of her parents.  

Her parents where the ones who taught her to grow corn, beans, and coffee.  Presently, she makes a living growing corn with her partner, who is her only support, on a piece of land that she owns thanks to savings and to God.  The land is located on the same property where they live.  Because of this, maintaining the crops and providing technical assistance is much easier.  The customers for her products, once the corn has been shelled and cleaned, are the different small shops and grocery stores in other municipalities outside of where she lives.

Currently, she needs help in order to buy certified corn seeds for planting.  Through this, she will be able to plant more and her income will be greater so that she can reinvest in her land.  Her plans are to improve and fertilize the land that they plant so that the new seeds will stick and their plants will grow healthy and fertile, making it easier to maintain the crops. 

Her dream, like every mother, is to support her son in his studies.  She hopes to be able to send him to university so that he can graduate in a profitable career, and not be in the same situation as her and her partner when they were young.

loans.use: to buy certified corn seeds for planting.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is 60 years old, and the father of four children. He has been in the business of selling different items for 15 years. He would like to get the loan to buy more rice, sugar, soaps and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, soaps, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is 32 years old. He sells shoes and has been in the business for six years. With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more pairs of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Kantutas De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTA DE LOS ANDES” iniciará el vigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Francisca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, saumerío, venta de medicina natural, venta de conservas, taller de carpintería, tejido de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Francisca es integrante, ella indica que hace treinta años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que la visito en su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por la experiencia que tenía en trabajar en otros lugares.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra arroz, fideo, etc.) que adquirirá de las tiendas, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.

Al grupo acompaña la hija de una de las socias ella esta ubicada en la puerta
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kantuta De Los Andes" will begin its twentieth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de los Andes [Local Center of the Andes].  The group is made up of eight members and is led by a committee of directors; Francisca is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank are involved in are varied and include: weaving blankets, neighborhood stores, incense, natural medicine sales, canned food sales, carpentry workshop, and weaving sweaters.  The loan that they take out will benefit these small micro-businesses.

Francisca is a member of this group.  She says that she has been part of Pro Mujer for thirty years, joining through the invitation of one of the institution's promoters, who visited her at her house.  Presently, she has a business selling food.  She says that she learned this business through the experiences she had working in other places.

The loan that she will take out today is to grow her capital (rice, noodles, etc.).  She will acquire these items at stores, wholesale, and will later make the items and sell them in her stall.  This form of work allow her to generate revenue in order to maintain her home.  She is married and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings.

One of the member's daughters is also in the photo; she is standing in the door.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 32 years old. She has been selling soaps, rice and other items for the couple of years. 

With the loan, she wants to add more soaps, cooking oil and rice in her boutique. 

Laurence is very thankful for the help to improve the standards of the family. She plans to use the profits for renovating the house.

loans.use: to buy soap, cooking oil and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a heifer.

loans.name: Gratien

texts.en:
Gratien is 35 years old. He is married and they have three children between six months and six years. Two go to school. 

With the loan, he wants to buy more used shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Al-Moatz Group

texts.en:
Al-Moatz group consists of five ladies from Hadramout, Yemen. Each member has her own type of business. They have requested a group loan of 150,000 YER, and they will hold each other accountable for loan repayment. 

Afrah is 39 years old and lives with her family in Hadramout, Yemen. She has started a business of selling perfumes and clothes. She is an uneducated woman from a poor family. She decided to help her family and earn some money to provide better living conditions for her children. 

She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy perfumes and clothes to keep her business running and expand it. She looks forward to making large profits and starting to accumulate money to have her own clothing store.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and clothes to keep her business running and expand it.

loans.name: Batbolor

texts.en: Batbolor, 33, lives with her husband and 4 daughters in apartment in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Sergelen, is helping his wife to start a family business selling cosmetics at a rental counter in a local market. Three of her daughters, whose ages range from 6 to 15, study at local schools, and her youngest daughter, Gegeentuya, is 3 years old; she stays at home. Batbolor has been working as a cosmetics store saleswoman since 2008 and has gained a lot of experience in the business. She is now requesting 5,100,000 MNT to purchase a starting inventory for her business. She and her husband both are hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase a starting inventory for her business.

loans.name: Leslia Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios de éxito una de ellas es Lesly Vanessa tiene 29 años casada, con un hijo menor de edad, su negocio es la venta de calzado, ropa y cosméticos desde hace dos años, de ser cliente de la institución tiene dos años consecutivos, los productos los comercializa en su comunidad y a trabajadores de zona franca en la ciudad de Masaya. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón jingo de varón, pantalón Levy de varón, cosmético perfume sentimientos, perfume faroway de mujer, lápiz de cejas, vanidades, crema para las manos, crema para el cuerpo, cremas faciales etc. Vilma tienen 30 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y Miguel tiene 26 años y su negocio es la de brindar servicios de moto taxi en su comunidad.
texts.en:
